column8: Chief Minister Lim Guan Eng will file a motion today at the Penang High Court to declare Section 62 of the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission Act 2009 "unconstitutional".Section 62 of the MACC Act deals with the defendant's defence statement and his or her right to remain silent.Read more: https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/368317#ixzz4UwoAj6Jj

It states that "Once delivery of documents by the prosecution pursuant to Section 51a of the Criminal Procedure Code has taken place, the accused shall, before commencement of the trial, deliver the following documents to the prosecution: (a) a defence statement setting out in general terms the nature of the defence and the matters on which the accused takes issue with the prosecution, with reasons; and (b) a copy of any document which would be tendered as part of the evidence for the defence."The law has been in place for quite some time, said the Judge
